Docs.param: The that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
Docs.summary: Writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> method.
The default implementation does the following for every WS-Trust contract found:
1. Includes the appropriate WS-Trust namespace in the WSDL.
2. Imports the appropriate WS-Trust schema and all dependent schemas.
3. Fixes the Messages of each operation to appropriate WS-Trust equivalents. The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out. But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC. This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out. But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC. This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages specified by the XML qualified names in `inputMessageElement` and `outputMessageLement`.
